H0.text: On which label did Chuck Berry record in the 1950s and 1960s. Chess

H1.text: On which label did Chuck Berry record in the 1950s and 1960s. RCA Victor

H2.text: On which label did Chuck Berry record in the 1950s and 1960s. Atlantic

H3.text: On which label did Chuck Berry record in the 1950s and 1960s. Cög

A4.text: With Chess, he recorded 'Maybellene'—Berry's adaptation of the country song 'Ida Red'—which sold over a million copies, reaching number one on Billboard magazine's rhythm and blues chart.

A5.text: By the end of the 1950s, Berry was an established star, with several hit records and film appearances and a lucrative touring career.

A6.text: In 1958, Chess began producing their first LP records which included such albums as After School Session by Chuck Berry

A7.text: Musicians such as Bo Diddley, Willie Dixon, Chuck Berry, Howlin' Wolf, Muddy Waters, and Buddy Guy released music under Chess that was influential in early rock and roll
